alert.note: Alert for Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Western Monmouth (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 3:57PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mercer, north central Burlington, southwestern Monmouth and southwestern Middlesex Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Georgetown, or 11 miles south of Trenton, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Holly, Hightstown, Bordentown, Cranbury, Allentown, Pemberton, Roosevelt, Wrightstown, Princeton Meadows, Windsor, Plainsboro Center, Jacksonville, Georgetown, Clearbrook Park, Edinburg, Crosswicks, Twin Rivers, Whittingham, Imlaystown and Mercerville-Hamilton Square. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 7 and 8A. Interstate 195 in New Jersey between mile markers 2 and 13. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 54 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for southern, central and northern New Jersey.

area.areaDesc: Mercer; Middlesex; Northwestern Burlington; Western Monmouth
